meanings.sent1: The charity refounds its projects every year to help more people.
meanings.sent2: After the event, they decided to refound the scholarship for students in need.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel refounds its nut collection after the mischievous raccoon scattered them around.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for education refounds her determination to support underprivileged students.
meanings.sent5: The rain refounds the dried-up river, bringing life back to the barren land.

meanings.sent1: The town council plans to refound the old library as a community center.
meanings.sent2: The artist's goal is to refound the art gallery to showcase local talent.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly tries to refound the vanished rabbit back into the hat.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise refounds hope in the hearts of those who have lost their way.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's dedication refounds a sense of purpose in her students' lives.

meanings.definition: To give back money in exchange for a returned item
meanings.sent1: The store refounds customers who return defective products.
meanings.sent2: The company policy allows customers to refound items within 30 days of purchase.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tries to refound the chewed-up shoe to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The kind gesture of refounding the lost wallet earned him a loyal customer.
meanings.sent5: The vending machine quickly refounds the money when the snack gets stuck.
